description: Clipping of tarmacadam, which is tar +â€Ž macadam (crushed stones). Originally a trademark owned by its inventor Edgar Hooley.

entries.meaning: (loosely, UK, Ireland, Canada) Any bituminous road surfacing material.
(UK, Ireland, Canada) The driveable surface of a road.
(informal, aviation) The area of an airport, other than the runway, where planes park or maneuver.

verbs.description: tarmac (third-person singular simple present tarmacs, present participle tarmacking or tarmacing or tarmaccing, simple past and past participle tarmacked or tarmaced or tarmacced)

entries.meaning: (Britain, Canada) To pave with tarmacadam or a similar material.
examples: Residents in Bolton are angry after workmen tarmaced only one half of their road leaving the other half strewn with potholes.

entries.meaning: (aviation) To spend time idling on a runway, usually waiting for takeoff clearance.
